description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.

columns.name: MED_DOSAGE_END_DATE
columns.description: Stores the calculated end date of the order when using the wide end date feature

columns.name: FIRST_DOSE_EDU_PATIENT_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number of the patient encounter associated with first-dose education.

columns.name: PENDED_PREV_SIG
columns.description: For a pended medication order, this holds the contents (if any) of the "Sig (Previous)" display item from the order composer.  If populated, this is the sig (ORD 7055) of the source order at the time the reorder was created.

columns.name: DOSE_ADJ_ACCEPTED_YN
columns.description:
Stores whether the dose adjustment is accepted.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: MED_DOSE_CALCULATION_DESC
columns.description: Stores medication dose override dose programming point calculation.

columns.name: NUM_DOSES_TO_SCHED
columns.description: Stores the number of doses that should actually be scheduled after reconciling a pre-existing OP order into an encounter which schedules OP meds

columns.name: DO_NOT_SCHED_PAST_DATE
columns.description: Stores the last date on which it is OK to schedule an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds

columns.name: SCHED_FROM_PERIOD
columns.description: Stores the period to start scheduling from for an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds

columns.name: SCHED_FROM_PERIOD_DURATION
columns.description: Stores the remaning number of days in the period to start scheduling from for an OP order that has been reconciled into an encounter that schedules OP meds

columns.name: SEND_TO_PHARM_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description:
Reasons for sending a prescription directly to a pharmacy. For Australia e-prescribing.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Given to Patient


Dosing Point


Staged Supply


Repeats Kept on File

columns.name: RX_MOBILE_NUM
columns.description: Patient's mobile phone number. For Australia e-prescribing.

columns.name: STARTED_TAKING_DATE
columns.description: The date the patient reports they started taking a medication

columns.name: RX_REQ_SUBTYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item specifies the subtype of the external change request this order represents. It is only set on orders created by external pharmacies, and is used in conjunction with ORD 7499.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Site Verification Notification


Unverified Site Reminder
